result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik W Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik W Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept of Revenue, along with supporting Reminder Notices.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF161 & #14CF197 called at 1:02pm. 
Defendant Erik W Smith in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Service of the Amended Informations in each case admitted; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1 in case #14CF197, and on Counts #1, #2, #3 in case #14CF161; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Smith guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered in each case .


On Count #1 in case #14CF197, and on Counts #1, #2, #3 in case #14CF161, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Smith on Probation for two year, with conditions:

--to serve thirty days in the Jefferson County Jail [on Count #1 of case #14CF161 only], with work-release privileges for all purposes, to commence on  8/11/14 at 7:00pm.
---Mr. Smith is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all treatment recommendations
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or educational program as directed by the Agent
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge on each count


Days credit for time already served in Case #14CF161: 0  days
Days credit for time already served in Case #14CF197: 3  days

In Case #14CF161, the Court orders suspension of driving privileges for one year; it is the Court's intention that this suspension will run concurrently with the six month suspension that was imposed in the Watertown Municipal Court OWI 1st case.
recess 1:21pm
Pre-trial conference on July 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

[clerk: MK]
cases #14CF161 & #14CF197 called at 9:30am. 
Defendant Erik W Smith in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Smith waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in both cases; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment held on both cases:
--service of Informations admitted, readings waived; the charges and maximum penalties in each case are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Mr. Smith verifies that the 220 E. Water Street address remains current. 
recess 9:34am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/9/14 at 9:00am.  (2) schedule Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
defendant signed bond on 6/9/14, originbal bond returned to COC by JCSD on 6/10/14

Case called at 1:58 pm
Defendant Erik W Smith in custody via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Court finds the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek advises the defendant qualifies for SPD representation in the case and alos in case 14CF161 and that she will be assigned the cases.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No discussion of the case with Heidi Smith
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 6/12/14 at 2:30 pm, if for any reason the SCRAM cannot be installed the defendant is to be returned to Court immediately to have the issue of his bail to be readdressed.

Court notes that the defendant may have issue with the cost of SCRAM, if there is any reason that the SCRAM bracelet cannot be installed on 6/12/14 then the defendant is to be returned to Court immediately (the Court notes it will make room in its schedule to hear the case) to re-address the issue of bond.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that 14CF161 is set for Preliminary Hearing for 6/23/14 at 9:00 am and request that this case be set on for a Preliminary Hearing at that date and time and notes that since that is within the time limits there is no need to waive.
Court informs parties that it will Make the note regarding the scheduling of the Prelimianry Hearing.

Recess: 2:10 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: to be set-- Attorney Svehlek requested 6/23/14 at 9:00 am along with 14CF161
